abstract.text: Add deep links to your widgets and Live Activities that enable people to open a specific scene in your app.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

metadata.title: Linking to specific app scenes from your widget or Live Activity

inlineContent.text: People interact with a widget or Live Activity to launch a scene in the corresponding app with matching content and functionality. For example, when people click or tap a Stocks widget, the Stocks app opens to a page that displays information about that stock price.
When you create widgets and Live Activities, think about how people interact with them. Make sure interactions launch the scene in your app that fits the widget’s content or the Live Activity.

content.text: Launch a specific screen in your app

inlineContent.text: By default, tapping or clicking your widget or Live Activity opens its corresponding app. To provide a good experience and not make people navigate to get to the right place in your app, open the app at a scene that matches the content of the widget or Live Activity. To open a specific screen in your app, add the
modifier to a view in the view hierarchy of your widget or Live Activity.
If the view hierarchy includes more than one
modifier, the behavior is undefined.
For example, the following code snippet from the
sample code project shows how the small widget uses
to allow people to open the app and show a character’s detail information:
For widgets with enough space for more than one interaction target —
, and larger system family sizes — add one or more
controls to your view hierarchy. You can use one
and additional
controls. If an interaction targets a
control, the system uses the URL in that control. For interactions anywhere else in the widget, the system uses the URL you specify in the
view modifier.
For example, the leaderboard widget of the
app displays a list of characters. Each item in the list uses a
control to launch the scene in the app for the specific character that the item represents.
When the widget or Live Activity receives an interaction, the system activates the containing app and passes the URL to
, or
, depending on the life cycle your app uses.

abstract.text: Extend the reach of your app by creating widgets, watch complications, Live Activities, and controls.
Include buttons or toggles in a widget or Live Activity to offer app functionality without launching the app.

abstract.text: Use SwiftUI animations to indicate data updates in your widgets and Live Activities.

doc://com.apple.WidgetKit/documentation/.title: Animating data updates in widgets and Live Activities

to provide user-configurable options.

definition to provide user-configurable options.

abstract.text: Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the app successfully recreates the specified activity.
Tells the delegate to open the resource at the specified URL.
A request to fulfill in your app or Intents extension.
A control for navigating to a URL.
Registers a handler to invoke in response to a user activity that your app receives.
Registers a handler to invoke in response to a URL that your app receives.
Sets the URL to open in the containing app when the user clicks the widget.
Tells the delegate that the data for continuing an activity is available.
Asks the delegate to open a resource specified by a URL, and provides a dictionary of launch options.
A representation of the state of your app at a moment in time.
The SiriKit interaction object to use when configuring your app.
